meanings.definition: To grant immunity or protection against a disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended the vaccine to premune the child against the flu.
meanings.sent2: It is important to premune yourself against common illnesses by maintaining good hygiene.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special suit could premune him from any harm, even from the most dangerous viruses.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude seemed to premune her from the negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion was said to premune anyone who drank it from all diseases.

meanings.definition: Having immunity or protection against a disease.
meanings.sent1: The premune individual did not get sick even when others around them were ill.
meanings.sent2: The premune population showed lower rates of infection during the flu season.
meanings.sent3: The cat, feeling premune, confidently explored the outdoors without fear of getting sick.
meanings.sent4: The ancient talisman was believed to bring premune powers to whoever possessed it.
meanings.sent5: The premune shield protected the village from any disease that tried to enter.
